revised_title: Optical Activity of Nucleoproteids in Pancreas, Thymus, and Suprarenal Gland
tldr: The authors conducted research on the nucleoproteids found in the pancreas, thymus, and suprarenal gland, focusing on their optical activity. They discovered that nucleoproteids are dextrorotatory bodies, meaning they rotate plane-polarized light in a clockwise direction. This research helped expand the understanding of the complex albuminous substances found in the nucleated protoplasm of animal organs.
